availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Farmer Dewees (Lexington, Kentucky, teller and banker)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, bank teller and gentleman. Woodford County, Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel Dewees and Mary Coburn Dewees. Teller at the old branch of the United States Bank in Lexington. Teller at the Northern Bank of Kentucky in Lexington. Gentleman in Lexington in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 116.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 59.
Mrs. Philip E. LaMunyan, The Dewees Family: Genealogical Data, Biographical Facts and Historical Information (Norristown, PA: William H. Roberts, 1905), 105-06.
George W. Ranck, History of Lexington Kentucky: Its Early Annals and Recent Progress (Cincinnati: Robert Clarke & Co, 1872), 402-03.
Find A Grave, "Farmer Dewees (1795-1869)," Memorial #99746794, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99746794/farmer-dewees (accessed January 5, 2018).
